direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really. OK, Dad. But seriously, Anthony. These are fast shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've never had a pair of fast shoes in your life, Dignan. (to Bob) In fifth grade Dignan used to wear cowboy boots for P.E.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's real cool, Anthony. Yeah, I wore boots. My parents wouldn't buy me any $200 running shoes like yours. I wasn't spoiled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't call me spoiled, Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were spoiled rotten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough. Jesus Christ. EXT. SIDE OF HIGHWAY. DAY Anthony and Dignan are lined up to race on the side of the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling) You want to say it, Bob? Fifty yards away, Bob's sitting on the hood of the car parked on the shoulder. He's reading a magazine. He shakes his head without looking up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll just say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On your marks... (waits a second, says very fast:) Get set go. They take off. Dignan has the jump, but Anthony pulls past him. A car blows by going the other way and they keep racing. Anthony's out in front as they pass Bob sitting on the car. Bob's watching. Dignan raises his fists into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (points at Anthony) You owe me fifty bucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anthony won. Bob gets in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob wasn't even looking. EXT/INT. MOTEL. DAY A Holiday Inn. Bandera, TX. Bob's car is parked in front. Inside: Dignan, Bob, and Anthony are checking in. There's a teenage GIRL behind the counter. Dignan pays cash. The girl hands over the keys. She's looking at Dignan's shirt:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was that shirt made from a towel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (seeing his reaction) It's just terrycloth, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I think so. EXT. MOTEL. DAY They're walking along the balcony, looking for their room. Anthony has on his backpack. Dignan's got his tennis bag. Bob's got two large suitcases, a carry-on, and a garment bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, man. She didn't know anything about shirts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm not saying her. I'm just saying, I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a great shirt. Don't worry about it. They find the room and unlock the door. INT. CAR. NIGHT Driving in a small town. Bob's behind the wheel. Dignan's in front. Anthony's in back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Armored trucks are very difficult to steal, Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. But once you get inside you're home free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.. Get back to me on that one. Once your plan is worth a shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not a plan. It's just -- DIGNAN Actually. If you knew the exact route, you could plant explosives under a manhole cover and blow it up as it went over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but you wouldn't have the truck if you blew it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: True. There's a car stopped in front of them. A couple of girls are standing beside it, talking to the driver. Bob can't get around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck is this? Dignan leans over and holds down the horn for about five seconds. The guy in the car sticks hi s hand out the window and shoots the finger at them. Dignan sounds dead serious:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ram him, Bob. Bob waits for a nervous moment. He does two quick honks. The guy's reverse lights go on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hit him! Bob hits the gas and slams into the car. He puts his car in reverse and backs up a couple of feet. He leans forward and sees the back of the guy's car. It's all smashed up. The guy gets out of his car, shaken up, and looks at them. His expression is confused. Bob punches it and flies backwards down the street. The guy stands beside his car and watches them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, Bob. What the fuck did you do that for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wouldn't move. They go around the corner. Bob shifts into first and goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he chasing us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speed up, Bob. INT. MOTEL ROOM. NIGHT They're unlocking the door. They go inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think he got my license plates?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looked too shaken-up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure he did. We'll have to get new plates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's registered in my mother's name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes his head) What the fuck possessed you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the one who kept saying ram him. Dignan's walking into the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I meant tap him. As a warning. Dignan closes the door. Anthony lies down on one of the beds. Bob just stands there. INT. MOTEL ROOM. MORNING The next day. Dignan and Bob are still asleep. Bob's on a folding bed. Anthony's sitting at the table, reading a newspaper eating some cereal from one of those little boxes where you cut open the sides. EXT. MOTEL POOL. DAY Ahthony's swimming laps. He stops and hangs onto the side for a minute. Across the pool he can see a good-looking Mexican MAID about twenty years old standing beside her cart looking at him. He waves. She waves and gets back to work. A little while later. Anthony's sitting in a chair by the pool, letting the sun dry him off. He's wearing just a swimsuit. Dignan and Bob are fully dressed, standing beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dignan, I can't get my hair cut. That's just not possible, all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you're going to have to dye it, Anthony. We've got to hide our identities. Especially after Bob crashed the car. Bob has no reaction to this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Dignan. I'm sorry. I can't do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even if it's the difference between some trooper recognizing us and throwing us in prison or not? Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Bob, Samson has decided that his hair is more important than our safety. (screaming) My friend, that is a reckless decision! Let's go, Bob. Dignan starts walking away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob. Are you coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you in a little while.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you, Bob. INT. MOTEL ROOM. DAY Anthony's wearing a bathrobe, sitting on one of the beds. The maid unlocks the door and looks inside. She sees Anthony and starts to go back out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's OK. Come on in. She goes in and starts cleaning up. Anthony sits down in one of the chairs and makes conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's hot out, isn't it? Yeah. This is a nice little town. So, what, do you do all these rooms yourself? Or what? I'm Anthony. He puts out his hand. She shakes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inez? She nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me give you a hand with that. He helps her make the beds. EXT. MOTEL HALLWAY. DAY Anthony walks with Inez from room to room, helpinq her clean up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you say nineteen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dies y nueve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. Yeah. Yo soy dies y nueve. How old are you? INT. MOTEL ROOM. DAY Inez opens the door to one of the room.. They go in to clean it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you ever scared of finding a dead body in one of these rooms?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (laughs) No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It could happen. This is the exact kind of place where it happens. But I don't want to scare you. Anthony picks up a magazine off somebody's suitcase. He flips through it. Inez takes it out of his hands and puts it back on the suitcase. INT. BATHROOM. DAY Inez is putting a new bar of soap in the shower. Anthony picks up some wet towels off the floor. It's cramped in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People think because they're in a hotel they can act like a slob. It's bad manners. Inez takes the towels. She pulls the shower curtain shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were you born in Mexico?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cuba.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, really? That's interesting. Do you prefer Cuba or the United States? Inez is trying to get out of the bathroom but Anthony's in the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scuse me. EXT. MOTEL HALLWAY. DAY Inez is pushing the cart. Anthony has his hand on the cart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These towels are still warm. He picks one up and holds it to his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess from the dryer. He hands the towel to Inez. She holds it to her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never met anybody from Cuba before. Inez says a few sentences of very fast Spanish. Anthony nods. Inez knocks on the door of a room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Housekeeping. A WOMAN about thirty-five years old opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're just checking out. The woman goes back into the room. Inez follows her. INT. MOTEL ROOM. DAY The woman's packing a bag on the bed. Anthony comes in. The woman looks at him. 8he's about to say something when Anthony takes the liner out of the trashcan. The woman's HUSBAND comes out of the bathroom. Anthony picks up some stuff off the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Anthony follows Inez into the bathroom. The husband looks at his wife. INT. BARBERSHOP. DAY Diqnan's sitting in the waiting area of a barbershop reading a newspaper. We can see Bob out the window, talking on a pay phone. He hangs up and comes inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can go first, Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My brother's in jail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about? EXT. BARBERSHOP. DAY They're standing next to the spinning striped pole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The weed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's not his. How can they arrest Future Man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They said he's a drug dealer. Bob looks off into the distance. Sickened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those assholes. We got rapes. Murders. Violent crimes every second. And this is what they come up with. (shaking his head) They're just fucking him because he's from a prominent family. INT. DINER. DAY They're sitting at a table, waiting for their order.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think they can make it stick, Bob. I mean, what do they actually have on Future Man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, the marijuana crop is a good start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That could be anybody's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They also found my two beam scale in the garage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since when is it a crime to have a scale in your house? Everybody has a scale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cops say it's a special kind of scale drug dealers use in selling marijuana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So tell them the truth. What do you use it for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) I was just going to use it to see how much I had. Dignan mulls this over for a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long has he been in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then how come they haven't set the bail yet? That's unconstitutional.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll have to see when we get back. Dignan looks at Bob for a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean get back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) Well, obviously, we got to go back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob, that makes no sense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dignan, he's my brother. I can't just leave him there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This could be a trap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't "Come on, Dignan" me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (louder) Not in that car you're not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck, since I got the keys. Bob glares at Dignan. Dignan shrugs. The waitress brings over some glasses of water, ice clinking. Nobody says anything while she sets them down. She walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me the keys, Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do that, Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dignan. You're going to give me those keys or you're going to get hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't threaten me, Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit, Dignan! It's my car! If you don't give me my keys, I swear to God -- EXT. STREET. DAY Dignan drives the car slowly alongside: Bob walking down the sidewalk, staring straight ahead. Dignan's, got his window down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Bob. I understand your loyalty. You're a good person. But right now you're not using your best judgement. Bob keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Future Man would not want you to go to jail I promise you. Just get in the car and we'll talk about it. No reaction. Bob keeps walking straight ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Future Man would never go to jail for you, I'll tell you that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His name's not Future Man, Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it's not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't even know his name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just get in the car, Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's his name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob. I don't know his name. You know why? Because I don't care. He's Future Man. But I care about you. And to me it doesn't make sense to go back to the scene of a crime. Will you get in the car, Bob? This is stupid. Bob stops walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not your decision and he's not your brother, Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. I only have one vote. We'll go talk with Anthony and figure it out. Pause. Bob gets into the backseat. Dignan looks back at him for a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to ride in the back? Bob nods and looks out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Bob. Get in front. Bob exhales and gets out. He gets in up front. Dignan looks at him for a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got a beautiful walk, Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go. INT. MOTEL ROOM. NIGHT Dignan and Bob open the door and go in. Inside: Inez and two other Hispanic MAIDS are sitting at the table by the window. One's about seventeen and a little heavy, the other's in her mid-thitties. There's a bunch of glasses and a bottle of rum on the table. One of the maids is cutting up a banana. Inez smiles at Dignan. Dignan looks puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. How's it going. Suddenly there's a loud crunching, grinding sound. Dignan and Bob are startled. They look around the room. The sound stops. Anthony comes out of the bathroom carrying the pitcher from a blender. It's full to the top with yellow liquid. He sees Dignan and Bob and stops. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you guys went to get your hair cut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. We didn't. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're making banana daqueris. Anthony holds up the pitcher. Dignan looks at it. Nods. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Inez. Carmen. Anita.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inez, this is -- DIGNAN Jerry. (pointing to Bob) And this is my associate Cornelius. A strange expression crosses Bob's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I have a word with you, please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. EXT. MOTEL HALLWAY. NIGHT Outside the room. Dignan closes the door. There's three housekeeping carts in the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck is going on here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What. What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anthony, we're on the run from the law here. Did you tell these people your real name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I didn't. Dignan, they don't speak English.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Not really. Inez speaks a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the left. Dignan cracks open the door and looks inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's from Cuba.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No kidding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (closes the door) Anthony. Bad news. EXT. MOTEL POOL. DAY They walk around the motel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long are they going to hold him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I don't know anything. Except Phil says they got him. And he's in jail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He needs to hire an attorney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no. Look. OK. Let's stay here until we find out what's going on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anthony, I -- ANTHONY And if Future Man doesn't get let out of jail in 48 hours, then we go back. All right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now that makes sense. We'll hang out for a couple of days. Get a little R&R. Make sure Future Man's
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : A minute later. They've looped back. They're looking for the girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : Anthony waiting outside the office door. Rob, the first employee, and the manager are sitting against the wall in the office. The manager's got an intense, angry look on his face, staring at Dignan. Dignan hands Anthony five little bags full of money and starts to close the office door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and then get back on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As long as he gets out OK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Obviously. That's a given.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that OK? Pause. Bob looks at Dignan. Looks at Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugs) Yeah. I guess so. They shake hands and start back to the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, now we've got a plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about it, Bob. INT. MOTEL ROOM. NIGHT Anthony, Dignan, Inez, Carmen, and Anita are sitting crowded around the little table by the window in the motel room. They've got banana daqueris and a bottle of wine. Moonlight comes through the window. Bob is standing up in front of them with a banana daqueri in his hand. He's singing a blues number acapella. He's got a good voice. INT. MOTEL ROOM. NIGHT Dignan and Bob are playing slapjack with Carmen and Anita. Everyone's got their hands ready as  Carmen turns one card then the next. Bob's having a conversation in fluent Spanish with them about Las Vegas. He's talking about the rules at different casinos: Bally's, Caesar's, the Desert Inn. Dignan's paying close attention to the deck. A jack comes up and he slams it. EXT. MOTEL POOL. NIGHT There's a light in the pool. Anthony and Inez are swimming. Anthony swims around her with his eyes just above the water. He goes under and comes up grabbing onto her. She laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does my skin feel soft, Anthony?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (passionate) God, yes. Like silk. Inez starts to giggle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? (starts laughing) What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like silk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God. That does sound corny.  Oh, your skin feels so soft and silky. But it really kind of does. He kisses her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No lifeguard on duty. Swim at your own risk. They look up. Dignan's standng at the other side of the pool. He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I did save Anthony from drowning once, Inez. Tell her, Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, one day we were playing hot box over at my next door neighbor Mr. Langston's house and Anthony fell in the pool and got knocked unconscious. I had to dive in and save him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was in fourth grade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Langston performed cardiopulmonary recitation. CPR. I've never said this before, but frankly I thought Anthony was dead. The veins in his face were all sticking out. His skin was blue. He truly did look dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After that my parents never let me go to Dignan's again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They blamed my family for everything. They always said Mr. Langston saved Anthony's life. Dignan stares wistfully across the pool. Anthony looks at him for a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if it wasn't for Dignan I probably would of died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nodding, whisper voice) Yes...It's true. They're all quiet for a minute. Inez hangs onto the side. INT. MOTEL ROOM. NIGHT Bob's sitting in the room by himself, close to the TV, watching a war movie. EXT. MOTEL. DAY The next morning. Dignan bursts out the door of the motel room. He runs across the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch. Dignan runs back into the room. He comes out with Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gone. He stole the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where was it parked?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right here. Anthony looks around the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That coward. Son of a bitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he just went to the store.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He took his stuff. He's gone. (pause) I should of seen this. I should of expected it. Bob doesn't have any character. Anthony puts his hands in his pockets. Looks out at the highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He went back for his brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We said 48 hours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a long time to be in jail. They stand there in the empty parking lot. Anthony goes inside. INT. MOTEL ROOM. DAY In the room. The blinds are pulled. Anthony's sitting at the end of a bed. Dignan's pacing around the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll get him. Don't worry about that. We'll go back. We'll find him. And we'll blow up his car. Or do something. I promise you. Anthony gets up and walks to the bathroom. He shuts the door. Dignan follows him over to the sink and sits on the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, let's face it. Bob was dead weight. We're a lot better off without him. (pause) But who could expect it? Just like that. Steals the fucking car. What kind of person pulls that -- Anthony opens the door and walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob didn't steal the car. He told me he was going. He had to go help his brother. Anthony sits back down on the bed. Dignan's shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When'd he tell you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where was I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He told you and you let him do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He told me because he wanted to know if I wanted to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hesitates) If you wanted to go? What were you going to do? Just leave me here by myself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I didn't do it, did I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So when you were saying Bob's at the store and acting real suprised, that was just an act. You were just -- ANTHONY Bob went to help his brother. I understand that and I can't help it if you don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand that if I had a few more friends like you and Bob I'd be dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you say so. INT. DINER. DAY Anthony and Dignan are sitting at a booth. Anthony's got a roadmap spread out on the table. There's a long silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you'd gone with Bob you'd probably be in Weatherford by now. Of course I'd be here frantically worrying thinking you must of got kidnapped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't realize you had such an incredible ability to feel sorry for yourself, Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, the world is a little bit colder today. Anthony sits there thinking for a second, stating into space. Then he looks back at his map. He draws some lines in two different colors of felt tip pens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to look at the map? Pause. Dignan kind of looks at the map, without leaning forward. Anthony turns the map more in Dignan's direction. Dignan leans forward, looking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See. Here's where we are. They look at the map for a minute. Dignan looks out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know he had it in him. (pause) I guess you could say the child has become the father of the man. EXT/INT. MOTEL/TOWN. DAY Anthony runs down the sidewalk, cuts across the street, and goes around the side of the motel. He pulls off his jacket as he goes up the stairs. He spots Inez's cart. He walks over to the room she's cleaning. She's in there making the bed. Anthony closes the door and grabs her by her belt. She's laughing and he pushes her onto the bed. He unbuttons her dress. She jerks a sheet out of the way. It swings in the air. Then we see Anthony and Inez walking down the sidewalk. He's got one arm wrapped tight around her shoulders and she's got hers around his waist. They're talking while they walk, going past people in the town. They watch each other walking reflected in a window. EXT. MOTEL. EVENING Dignan is doing the butterfly in the pool. Anthony and Inez walk over and wait for him at the end of the pool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going over to this bar if you feel like going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'm going to swim. I'll see you later. Dignan treads water. Inez looks at Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you come with us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dignan gets out of the pool. INT. MEXICAN BAR. NIGHT Anthony, Dignan, and Inez are drinking beers with limes and salt. The mood is good and they're getting drunk. Anthony and Inez dance. Then Dignan and Inez. Mexican-style, stomping their feet and clapping. There's a scruffy dog in the bar and he barks at the dancers. Anthony kisses Inez and they whisper to each other. Dignan orders another beer and moves over to the pool table. A skinny Mexican MAN puts his arm around Dignan's shoulder. He's drunk and slurring his words. So's Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, my friend. You in the Army, yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I just have short hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that your chiquita?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, my friend knows her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She Chicano, yes? Dignan nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You like Chicanos?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. He says something in fast Spanish to the people at his table and they smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Play pool? For one cerveza. Dignan nods. The guy racks up the balls. They start shooting. Dignan makes a hard shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling) You a good pool player.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a little lucky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's your friend? He go with the chiquita? Dignan looks over to the bar. Anthony and Inez are gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is a good looking woman. Dignan ignores this. They keep playing. Dignan finally makes the eight ball. The man shakes Dignan's hand and holds on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess I'll get another Tecate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Si. Tecate. You like to fight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fight. You know. He pulls Dignan in and with his other hand fakes a hard punch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Just pool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You Hoto?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pulls away) Fuck you. You a Hoto.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) No. Me no Hoto. Tecate?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. INT. BATHROOM. NIGHT The bathroom is very small with one bare light bulb. Dignan stands at the urinal, muttering to himself. The door opens and Dignan turns around just in time to see the Mexican man throw a hard punch. He hits Dignan in the stomach, punches him in the face. Dignan goes down hard. The guy kicks him and curses in Spanish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pinche cabrone. Puta madre. The bartender comes in with a bat in his hand and starts talking fast and angry in Spanish. The guy gets out. INT. MOTEL ROOM. NIGHT Dignan's sitting in bed, watching TV. He's got a fat lip and a big bruise over his eye. Anthony's sitting in a chair beside him. Inez brings over a glass of water and some ice in a washcloth. She gives the ice to Dignan for his eye. She puts the glass of water on the nightstand where there's some fast food layed out for Dignan: burger, fries, an apple pie. Inez goes into the bathroom, closes the door, and turns on the water. Anthony's sitting there with his hands clasped, not looking at the TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe he just jumped you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you hand me those french fries. Anthony hands him the fries. Dignan watches the TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I'd been there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would of been nice. Anthony looks at Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man. I'm sorry. We just went for a walk -- DIGNAN I don't really feel like talking about it. The only thing I feel like is getting the fuck out of this place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) We need a car. For the first time Dignan looks away from the TV, at Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have an idea for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inez has a master key to all these rooms, doesn't she? (pause) Doesn't she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think we can do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know we can. It's real simple. We go into a room, grab some car keys and -- ANTHONY What I'm saying is she wouldn't go for that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She doesn't need to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) I don't know, Dignan. I just -- DIGNAN Look. I'm ready to get the fuck out of here. It's real torture for me to be here. Getting the shit kicked out of me by Mexicans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one to back me up. Now I have a good idea. So unless you come up with something better -- ANTHONY Dignan. I can't do that. All right? I just can't. The bathroom door opens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you better think of something. Inez comes back in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you, Jerry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (staring at TV) I feel great, Inez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (kisses her) I'll see you later. Inez goes outside. She closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think we need any keys, Dignan. I think I can hotwire a car for us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know how to hotwire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I do. Bob taught me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob taught you how to get electrocuted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm serious. He made me a diagram. EXT. SIDEWALK. DAY Dignan's standing on a corner alone. He looks sullen. EXT. SIDEWALK. DAY Anthony walks down an alley. He goes past a beat-up convertible. He stops, hands in his pockets. He looks both ways. He cuts back to the car, opens the door, and slips inside. INT. STOLEN CAR. DAY Anthony's behind the wheel. He hand signals a turn and pulls up next to Dignan. Dignan shakes his head as he looks at the car. He gets in. They drive through the town. The wind's blowing hard. Anthony smiles at Dignan. Dignan tries not to smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you say to Inez? Anthony shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "I'll come back for you. I love you, Inez." Anthony is silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "I'm going to take you away from all this windexing and making beds." Silence. Dignan exhales and looks out the window. EXT. HIGHWAY. DAY The car is on the shoulder, raised up on a Jack with the hood open. Anthony's looking underneath the car. Dignan's standing in the middle the road with his hands in his pockets. No cars in sight. Anthony starts messing around under the hood. He tests some wires and connections. He steps away from the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, I don't know anything about cars. Dignan stares down the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really know how to pick them. Anthony walks over to Dignan. He stands beside him for a minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we better go home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't panic, Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not. But there's -- DIGNAN You can't just run home every time things get tough. First of all, we've got enough dough to -- ANTHONY Our money situation is not good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (clapping him on the back) You're so spoiled. What is "not good" to you? Only a few hundred -- ANTHONY We've got sixteen dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not correct. Dignan stares at Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it to me. Pause. Anthony reaches into his pocket and pulls out the money. Dignan takes it. He counts it. He looks at Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixteen dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's the rest? Dignan stares at Anthony. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had to give some to Inez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: $383. Dignan frowns slightly. Pause. He screams:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What! Pause. Dignan runs at the car and kicks the door as hard as he can. It makes a big dent. He runs down the shoulder and grabs a big rock. He runs at the car and smashes the rock through the windshield. He stands still. He turns to Anthony. He walks back over to him, yelling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gave $383 to the goddamn housekeeper! What the fuck is your problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She needed it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: $500 tip! For the housekeeper!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her name's Inez. Stop calling her the housekeeper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what she is!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that. But -- DIGNAN You're in love with the fucking housekeeper!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you going to do, get married? Have a bunch of little idiot janitor brats! And go around scrubbing the -- Anthony slaps Dignan hard in the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop! (pause) Now listen to me. Dignan punches Anthony is the face. Follows it up with one after another. Anthony ducks and puts his arms out. He falls on one knee. Dignan immediately turns and walks to the car. Anthony stands up. He's got a bloody nose. He stares at Dignan. Not angry. Just weary. Dignan pulls his tennis bag out of the car. He shuts the door and walks down the highway. Anthony walks to the car and takes out his backpack. He pulls it tight around his shoulders. He looks down the highway at Dignan. Then turns and walks the other way, into the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob, where you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not playing any more golf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cause I'm not getting any better. It's a waste of time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've only been playing for two weeks, Bob. It takes a long time to learn this game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think I'm improving?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) Yes. You just got to stick with it. Bob looks down the fareway. He takes a deep breath and starts walking toward his club about twenty yards away. INT. GOLF CART. DAY In the cart. Bob's driving. There's a brief silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to talk about it if you don't want to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it must of been a bad experience. But it doesn't sound like it was your fault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I didn't mean to electrocute him. But the whole operation was my idea. MONTAGE: Electronics wizardry. Splicing wires. Buzzing electrodes. A filament lights up blue. Pliers and clippers rewire a circuit breaker, short out the P.A. system, electrify doors and windows. Anthony continues in VOICEOVER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It took six months of research. I did all the wiring myself. Switched
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : Dignan sitting with his feet in the pool. Anthony and Inez are sitting on the steps beside him, in the shallow end.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : Dignan sitting in the parked car with the motor running. In the side mirror he's watching Anthony and Inez. Anthony's saying goodbye. He walks back to the car and gets in. He puts it in gear and they drive off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . FADE IN: EXT. GOLF COURSE. DAY A cold day on a nice country club course. Anthony watches Bob hit a hard slide straight into the rough. Bob stands there in a frozen follow-through. Then he suddenly swings his club and hums it down the fareway. He starts to walk back to the golf cart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: to DC. Doubled the voltage. Shorted out the generator. The whole school was shut down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's pretty complicated for a senior prank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like that word prank, Bob. I was trying to do something more than a prank. EXT. SCHOOL. DAY A large school building. Tall oak trees and benches in the shade. Green and blue lights blink in the windows. White flashes and loud jolts of energy dance from room to room. Mozart plays in the distance. Students begin to swarm out into the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to create an event. Something everyone would remember. And at first it worked perfectly. The whole school was standing around outside. Kids running all over the place. Everybody laughing. EXT. GOLF COURSE. DAY Anthony and Bob are standing on the seventeenth green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even the school custodian Swifty thought it was great. He kept laughing and shaking his head the whole time he tried to disconnect the generator. And then suddenly (snaps his finger) total silence except for Swifty hanging off the generator with his leg stuck to it being electrocuted. Anthony stares down the fareway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually he died of a heart attack brought on by the shock. He was an older guy. INT. GOLF CART. DAY Anthony and Bob are driving back to the clubhouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I felt terrible. I'd known Swifty since first grade. He was Dignan's medicine man for Indian Guides. They called each other Rattlesnake and Killer Whale. Whenever Dignan came to visit me he would act like he and Swifty weren't that good of friends, but that was just to make me feel better. The whole rest of the school had turned against me. EXT. BOB'S HOUSE. DAY Anthony and Bob are sitting by the pool, drinking beers. Future Man's swimming laps even though it's cold out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At first they were going to charge me with manslaughter. That's partly why I was in custody so long. Sixty days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sixty days?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. One minute you're studying Great Expectations and the next minute you're drawing the Holy Mary for some kid who tried to stab his girlfriend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why were you drawing the Holy Mary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prison tatoos. I got to be pretty good. It's not like drawing on paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) It's a panther. Pause. Future Man looks at Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's that 700 bucks coming?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm working on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hard to find it sitting by the pool drinking beer and bullshitting. He walks inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought he didn't have to pay anything because of the technicality.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but he still has the aggravation. Three days sitting in a cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) Were you adopted, Bob?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you say that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, because you guys don't look alike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I wasn't adopted. Long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was Future Man adopted?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ! No. INT. CAR. DAY Dignan and APPLEJACK are sitting in, a '72 Monte Carlo by the curb two houses down from Bob's. Applejack is a small black man with white hair. It's hard to tell exactly how old he is. Around sixty-five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a lot of valuable shit in there, Applejack. The silver and the china. The crystal. And the grandfather clock. Goddammit, I bet that clock's worth ten grand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why the fuck do we need to blow up the car? It doesn't make any goddamn sense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just settling an old score. You might say revenge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sounds like a lot of bullshit that'll land us in jail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We might have to take that chance. Cause I feel pretty strongly about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that Buckethead? Anthony is walking Hector down the driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get down. Anthony does some stretching exercises in the driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a second. They watch Anthony and Hector start down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's your friend Anthony?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like he's staying with Buckethead. That's what I figured. He's probably got his own room. Let's see where he's going. Applejack puts the car in gear. They drive slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get too close. Anthony looks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop. He saw us. Anthony keeps jogging with Hector.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. Did he see us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going too slow. It looks like we're following him. Anthony goes around a corner, down an alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speed up. They pull down to the end of the alley. Anthony and Hector are racing down the alley. EXT. ALLEY. DAY Dignan gets out of the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anthony! Anthony looks back. He stops running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait up. Dignan jogs down the alley. He stops a few feet away from Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you going? Anthony points down the alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just walking Hector. Dignan looks down the alley. He looks at Anthony. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When'd you get back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah. Couple days ago. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (under his breath) You want to shake hands. Anthony puts his hand out. They shake. Pause. Anthony looks down the alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's in the car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Applejack. You want to meet him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. They walk to the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Applejack. They shake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to meet you, Applejack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're Anthony?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear you're a good thief. Anthony shrugs and smiles. He nods. EXT. HAMBURGER PLACE. DAY A hamburger place with no other customers. Anthony, Dignan, and Applejack are sitting at an outdoor table. It's cold and their jackets are zipped up tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just sitting at this bar drinking my drink when this fine chick walks by. She was a living doll. And the big motherfucker who came in with her sees me looking, when he walks by he steps on my foot. Doesn't say shit. Just takes a seat with his lady. Well, I holler out to him, If I was as big as you, ain't no way in the hell you'd of stepped on my foot like that. He just laughed. He says, Little man, take your foot and put it in your pocket. I said, No, how about I take my foot and I stick it up your ass? Man, we went to war right there. I hit him so hard I knocked his nuts in his watchpocket. But this motherfucker wouldn't go down. Then all the sudden, out of nowhere, Dignan came up behind him and smashed a bottle on his head. And that big old boy went down. That's how I met Dignan. Good cat to have on your side. He'll go to war with you. He don't give a fuck. Applelack and Dignan slap hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Applejack would of got him anyway. This was just the quicker war.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really hit a guy with a bottle? Dignan takes a little notebook out of his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty much. He kind of fell into me. But wait a second. Dignan opens the notebook on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to look at this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's big, Anthony. Real big. It's called Hinckley Cold Storage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's Hinckley Cold Storage? EXT. HINCKLEY COLD STORAGE. DAY Anthony, Dignan, and Applejack are standing in front of a massive structure with ladders and towers and huge doors. Applejack's car is parked behind them. There are trucks lined up along the loading docks. A big sign says Hinckley Cold Storage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Henry has an inside source. We call him Steve. That's where we get our information.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's Mr. Henry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll meet him this afternoon. He's helping us set it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you ever hear of the S. Cooper Trust robbery?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes his head) Uh-uh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Cooper Trust,in San Francisco?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-uh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Henry pulled that job in 1965. It's famous. Applejack was the wheel man. Did you use this same car, Applejack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, no. This is a '72. I was driving a '63 Pontiac.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What exactly is this place? Freezers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. Freezers. Imported foods. Anthony stares at Hitckley Cold Storage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go, Abdul-Shabazz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abdul-Shabazz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a nickname. EXT. WAREHOUSE. DAY Anthony, Dignan, and Applejack are standing on the sidewalk at the front door of an old warehouse. Dignan knocks on the door, then tries the bell. They all wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What time did he say to be here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right now. Dignan looks in the window. He tries the door. It's locked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can knock a man out with a six inch punch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feel this. Anthony puts his hand up. Applejack does a short, hard jab. Anthony shakes his hand out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whistles) You could give somebody a concussion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me feel that. Dignan puts his hand up. Applejack nails it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (grabbing his hand) Ow. Shit. A drop of water hits Dignan on the head. He looks up. More water falls on him. He gets out of the way. Everyone looks up. There's a man on the roof. He laughs, hysterically. They stare up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's the weather down there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) Mr. Henry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on in!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's locked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's not. Dignan shrugs. He goes over to the door. Mr. Henry pours some more water on him. A minute later: a steel garage door opens and the man steps outside. He is tall, about sixty years old with white hair clipped short and a trim goatee. He wears black trousers, black shoes, no shirt, and a string of animal teeth around his neck. This is MR. HENRY. He puts a towel around Dignan's shoulders and pats him on the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dignan. Good to see you. Good to see you Applejack. (looks at Anthony) Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Anthony Adams, Mr. Henry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is no good. Mr. Henry stares hard at Dignan. He looks to Anthony. He looks back to Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is no good, bringing him here. What are you thinking? What the shit, man? Are you crazy? Mr. Henry stares at Dignan. He looks to Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm pulling your leg. Abe Henry. They shake hands. Mr. Henry points to ROWBOAT, a tall, older black man standing in the doorway. Rowboat wears a white windbreaker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my business manager, Rowboat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to meet you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a sharp jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. INT. WAREHOUSE. DAY The second floor of the warehouse is one huge room painted all white. Mr. Henry and Anthony are playing ping-pong. Dignan watches. Rowboat-and Applejack are on the far side of the room playing chess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's hard to get much spin with this kind of paddle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's called a racquet, Anthony, and you're holding it wrong. That's ghetto play. Hold it like this. Anthony changes his grip. Mr. Henry serves. The ball clicks back and forth. They're both solid players. Anthony whips a shot crosscourt and wins the point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, your form is for shit, but you've got a hell of a talent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. Mr. Henry serves. Anthony returns. Mr. Henry suddenly fires a scorching shot down the line. Anthony watches it click past him. He looks to Mr. Henry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice shot. Mr. Henry smiles. He looks to Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Are you in, Anthony? Anthony stands there silent. He looks to Applejack and Rowboat. He looks to Mr. Henry. Then Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'm in. Mr. Henry puts down his paddle. Stares at Anthony. Smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OK, kid. Let's go talk about cops and robbers. INT. WAREHOUSE. DAY The ground floor is crammed with cars. Some have been taken apart. Some are shiny and perfect. Anthony and Dignan walk among the cars and junk with Mr. Henry. They've each got coffee in a styrofoam cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every once in a while some cat comes to me. He wants to know how I made it. How did I become a success? The first thing I tell them is: follow your instincts. Let your instincts guide you. The second thing I tell them is, for Christ's sake: you got to know your grammar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grammar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean grammar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The basic grammatical rules of robbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean like techniques?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods) Technique. That's right. Seventy- five percent of your job is crowd control. Seventy-five percent. Do you believe that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) Yes, I do. EXT. ROOFTOP. DAY On the roof of the warehouse. They're standing near the edge, looking out. Mr. Henry is smoking a joint. He's got on a black beret. Anthony and Dignan are listening to him talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the other hand you got to have the right equipment. I don't care if you're Harry Houdini. You can't pick a lock without a hairpin. Dignan nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to live in that place. Hinckley Cold Storage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Convert it into lofts. OK. Pop quiz. What's the single most important aspect of your job?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The grammar?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crowd control. Crowd control. Wake up, guys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to need a boxman for this one. But that can be arranged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean a safecracker?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. And I'll tell you who we're going to want: Kumar Banijamali.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's damn good. INT. KUMAR'S ROOM. DAY KUMAR is about sixty-five with white hair. He's short and wears a pale-green button-down shirt, dark trousers, and sandals. His room is small and has everything he needs in it. Books. Little TV. Possessions from all over the world. Kumar sits on his bed. Anthony and Dignan sit in wooden chairs. Kumar stares out the window. They sit for a long silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what do you think of the plan, Mr. Kumar? Kumar shrugs. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd love to have you on the team. Kumar nods. He looks at a plant growing by the window. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is that? An orchid? Kumar shakes his head. Sighs deeply. Long pause. Kumar suddenly stands up and unbuttons his shirt. He throws it on the bed. He undoes his trousers and takes them off. Anthony looks at Dignan. Kumar takes off his socks, then his shorts. He is naked. He walks over to his dresser and takes out a small satchell. He looks around the room. Right at Anthony. He walks quickly toward him. Anthony gets nervous. Kumar grabs Anthony's shoulder and lifts him up a little. He pulls a towel out from underneath Anthony. He puts his hand on Dignan's shoulder as he walks to the door, into the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good plan. He goes out. Anthony and Dignan sit there for a minute. They're a little disoriented.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods) He seems pretty good. INT. BOB'S HOUSE. NIGHT The foyer of Bob's house. The doorbell is ringing. Bob walks in wearing a velour robe. He opens the front door. Anthony and Dignan are standing on the dootstep. Dignan and Bob shake hands. It's a little awkward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Dignan. How's it going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on in. What you been up to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a whole lot, Bob. They walk through the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too bad about what happened on the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. It is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's not even talk about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was stupid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. It was extremely stupid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't expect an apology and I don't even want one. I just want us to -- DIGNAN I can't fucking believe this guy. An apology, Bob?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, I don't want to go into this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Let's keep it -- BOB Cause you would of let my brother rot in jail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said 48 hours!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never agreed to that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob, you're lying!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bullshit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right! Backyard! Right now! Dignan walks straight to the back door and goes out. He stands on the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go, Bob! Anthony gets up and tries to calm Dignan down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dignan. Take it easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob! Bob is slowly moving toward the back door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Dignan. This is stupid. Bob is standing just inside the back door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Dignan. Look. Let's just -- Dignan grabs Bob's shirt and pulls him out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop, Dignan! Anthony breaks them up. He stands in front of Bob, shielding him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't want to fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Diqnan. This isn't -- Dignan gets around Anthony and lands a glancing punch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to fight you, Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dignan, we're friends. Take it easy. Dignan lands another punch. He grabs Bob's shirt and pulls him around. Then he starts landing punches. One. Two. Then Bob nails Dignan in the shoulder. They grab onto each other and start fighting hard. They're about the same strength. After a couple of seconds Anthony tries to break it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dignan. Dignan. All the sudden Dignan stops fighting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Stop. Dignan puts his arms around Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No fighting. Dignan turns to Anthony. There's tears in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No fighting. It wasn't Bob's fault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, Dignan. It's OK. They all catch their breath for a minute. Dignan hugs Bob again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't your fault, Bob. You had your brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't have any choice. They stand there another minute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's OK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (starting to laugh) Shit, Dignan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) What the fuck are we doing out here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, Dignan. You went crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's OK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. We want you on the job. EXT. COUNTRY CLUB. DAY The restaurant at Bob's country club, People are dressed for golf and tennis. The waiters wear white jackets. and black bow ties. The whole crew sits at a big table by the front window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me get this straight. You don't play golf and you don't play tennis. So why do you belong to a country club?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes his head) You're a piece of work, Bob. A black waiter about thirty-five, JACKSON, stops by the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How you doing, Bob?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Jackson. How's it going? Jackson refills their water glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You keeping out of trouble?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looks at others at table) This boy's a troublemaker. He used to tear this place apart. Mr. Henry laughs. Bob smiles sheepishly. Jackson stands there for a minute looking around the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your brother was up here the other day. He said you ran away from home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said you ran away from home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I didn't run away. I went out of town. Jackson nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob. Bob looks at Dignan. Dignan's looking across the room. There's Future Man and his friend CLAY fresh from a round of golf. They're standing on the other side of the room, looking across at Bob. They're smiling. Jackson picks up two empty plates and walks away. Future Man and CLAY walk to Bob's table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fancy seeing you here, Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Hey, Clay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiling) So what's shaking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing much. Future Man looks at Anthony and Dignan. His smiles fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's it going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine, thanks. Future Man looks at the rest of the crew. His smile comes back. Mr. Henry smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John Mapplethorpe. (shaking hands with crew across table) How are you. Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good to know you, John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jackson says you told him I ran away from home. Clay laughs. Future Man smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I might have mentioned it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John, I'm twenty-six years old I didn't run away from home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, Bob. You were on a secret mission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd appreciate it if you didn't go around telling people lies about me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. I'm sorry. (looks at Clay) You've got a reputation to think about. Clay smiles. Bob shakes his head. Mr. Henry stands up. Everyone looks at him. He's got a cold but calm expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The world needs dreamers, son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The world needs dreamers. To relieve the pain of consciousness. Future Man nods. Pause. Mr. Henry doesn't sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we'll see you later, Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pleasure to meet you, John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hesitantly) Nice to meet you. Future Man and Clay walk away. Mr. Henry sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope this doesn't offend you, Bob. (looks closely at Bob) Your brother is a cocksucker. Bob smiles. They all smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. That doesn't offend me. EXT. HINCKLEY COLD STORAGE. DAY Dignan's hidden in some bushes, watching the Hinckley Cold Storage building with binoculars. Anthony's crouched beside him taking notes in a notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Man in blue jeans just left by southwest door. He is entering a white van. What time is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eleven fifteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mark that down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did. Dignan keeps watching through the binoculars. He suddenly looks back at Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God. Isn't this great? Working on the job. Got a wheel man. Got a safecracker. Good friends with Mr. Henry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. It's pretty good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like we've finally arrived. Anthony nods. He's writing something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you writing? Anthony shows him a little flip cartoon of a guy pole vaulting. INT/EXT. PLANNING SEQUENCE. DAY We see the team assembled around a table. They're drinking coffee and looking at pictures, charts, maps, diagrams, tools. Dignan passes out some walkie talkies. They test out some smoke cannisters on the roof. Dignan throws one down. They all run for cover. Applejack and Dignan drive fast through a slalom course in a deserted parking lot. We see Kumar working on a safe. He wears a stethoscope and listens to the tumblers. He turns the dial. Dignan is timing him with a stopwatch. Kumar opens the safe. He looks at Dignan. Dignan nods with a serious expression on his face. EXT. RAILROAD TRACKS. DAY Anthony and Mr. Henry are jogging along railroad tracks in the warehouse district. Anthony wears a blue T-shirt and shorts. Mr. Henry looks like a boxer in grey sweats with the hood up and a crisp white towel wrapped around his neck and tucked into his sweat top. He's wearing black Chuck Taylors. They've both got smooth running styles, though every twenty yards or so Mr. Henry rolls his shoulders and gives a quick flurry of punches. An older woman rides a bicycle across the tracks. She's not pretty, but she's got a strong face. Pioneer stock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at that woman. She's what? Fifty? Fifty-five? But she hasn't let herself go. I appreciate an older woman who has a commitment to her body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So do I. They watch her ride down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me something. What the hell kind of name is Dignan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not really sure. I think it's Irish. Or maybe -- MR. HENRY I guess what I'm trying to say is what the hell kind of person is this Dignan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean what kind of person? He's a good person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, sure. He's a great person, and I'd call bullshit on anybody who said differently. But I wonder if the kid has the goods (taps his temple) up here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (long pause) I don't think you're giving him enough credit. I know sometimes he doesn't think an idea through. He gets too excited. But -- MR. HENRY As far as I can tell he hasn't thought his life through. He'd be fine cutting my grass or parking my car. But business? (looks at Anthony) You I can work with. You I could groom. Dignan's not going to make it. Anthony stops running. Mr. Henry stops ahead of him and looks back, jogging in place. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're wrong about Dignan. Mr. Henry stops jogging in place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're wrong if you think, I'd turn my back on a friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold it. Mr. Henry walks to Anthony and puts his hand on his shoulder. Anthony knocks it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anthony. I want.to say one thing to you. Mr. Henry looks Anthony right in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations. You passed the test.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Abe Henry double-cross test. You just made a perfect score. Anthony has to recover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a test?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a deep breath. Anthony takes a deep breath. Mr. Henry massages Anthony's shoulders. He takes Anthony's head in his arms and does a quick pull to one side: cracks his neck. Then the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How does that feel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It feels good. Anthony rubs his hands on his neck and moves his head around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did Dignan take the test?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pause) Yes, he did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'd he do? They start jogging again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he agreed 100% that Bob should be dropped. And he also agreed you were a liability. But he felt his talent would make up for your weaknesses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That sounds like Dignan. They veer away from the tracks, picking up the pace, and head into a field toward Mr. Henry's warehouse. EXT. ROOFTOP. NIGHT They're having a party at Mr. Henry's warehouse. There are tables and a BBQ on the roof, with white Christmas lights strung up and music playing. Anthony, Dignan, Bob, Kumar, and Mr. Henry are there. Plus a couple of young GIRLS, eighteen or nineteen years old. Mr. Henry's got a name tag that says, Hi, my name is Mr. Henry. Everyone's mingling on the rooftop. Rowboat is at the grill. Applejack comes up the stairs with a grocery bag under his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woah. There he is. Applejack! What it is. Mr. Henry and Applejack shake hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is my car OK out there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love it. He always wants to know if the car's OK. Get a hot dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't eat pork.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Super K. Kumar. Come here. Mr. Henry goes over to Kumar and throws his arm around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know why the fuck we're having a party. The damn job's not over yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, this isn't really a party per se.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't celebrate til it's over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: True. Dignan's solemn for a minute. He takes a bite of a hot dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck are you doing? Dignan hesitates. He takes the hot dog away from his mouth. He's embarassed. Applejack shakes his head, disgusted. He walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that all about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramedan. Anthony and Mr. Henry are standing together in a doorway. Mr. Henry's got a martini.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you, Anthony. Times like this I get philosophical. What does it mean? What's it all about? Are you afraid to die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, that door over there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you afraid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I mean, I don't think about it all the time. But once in awhile I kind of go, Woah. Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. Woah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fear of death, The pain of consciousness. (taking a sip) Did you mix this martini?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Bob did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob. Bob. That's a palindrome. (laughs uproariously) I love palindromes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you afraid to die, Mr. Henry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looks right at him) Anthony, I'm petrified. Bob is talking to the other girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that sugarless gum you're chewing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not chewing gum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like a piece?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles brightly) Sure. Thanks. Kumar and Applejack are sitting at a table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If someone could copy my life story. If I had someone, man, to just write what I talk. I have so many stories. Bestseller, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been all over the Goddamn country. I've seen things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to go to Vegas and do headstands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No kidding.
direction.name: direction
